alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Gosper; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 7:45AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Phelps, southwestern Buffalo, northeastern Gosper and southeastern Dawson Counties through 815 AM CDT... At 744 AM CDT, an automated weather station reported a strong thunderstorm near Smithfield, or 9 miles south of Lexington, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Automated Weather Station. At 730 AM CDT, a personal weather station near Johnson Lake reported a gust of 47 MPH. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Elm Creek, Overton, Odessa, Amherst and Smithfield. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 240 and 265. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
